trans-unit.source: Represents a claim for a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token that asserts that the subject was authenticated by a particular means at a particular time.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify when the subject was authenticated.
The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements.
The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement>.
A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement> asserts that the statement's subject was authenticated by a particular means at a particular time.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement"></xref> class using the specified authentication details.
The set of authentication methods is extensible; however the following table contains the set of authentication methods defined in the SAML specification.
When the `authenticationMethod` parameter is `null`, the authentication method is set to `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified`.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> that represents the subject of the claim.
A URI reference that specifies how the subject was authenticated.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that specifies the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
The DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.
The IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding"></xref> that contains additional information about the subject.
Adds a claim based on the properties of this instance to the specified collection of claims.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AddClaimsToList%28System.Collections.Generic.IList%7BSystem.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim%7D%29> method adds a claim to the `claims` parameter based on the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationInstant%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationMethod%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthorityBindings%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.ClaimType%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.DnsAddress%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IPAddress%2A>, and properties.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that contains the set of claims to add to.
Gets or sets the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.
The time is stored in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationInstant%2A> property corresponds to the `AuthenticationInstant` attribute of the `<AuthenticationStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that specifies the instant in time at which the subject was authenticated.

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationInstant"></xref> property is set and the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true`.
Gets or sets the method used to authenticate the subject.
The set of authentication methods is extensible; however the following table contains the set of authentication methods defined in the SAML specification.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationMethod%2A> property is set to `null`, the authentication method is set to `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:am:unspecified`.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationMethod%2A> property corresponds to the `AuthenticationMethod` attribute of the `<AuthenticationStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The method used to authenticate the subject.

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationMethod"></xref> property is set and the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true`.
Gets additional information about the subject.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthorityBindings%2A> property corresponds to a set of `<AuthorityBinding>` child elements for an `<AuthenticationStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding"></xref> that contains additional information about the subject.
Gets the type of security claim.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimTypes"></xref> that specifies the type of security claim.
Gets or sets the DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.DnsAddress%2A> property corresponds to the `DNSAddress` attribute of the `<SubjectLocality>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The DNS domain name in which the computer that authenticated the subject resides.

The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.DnsAddress"></xref> property is set and the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true`.
Gets or sets the IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IPAddress%2A> property corresponds to the `IPAddress` attribute of the `<SubjectLocality>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The IP address of the computer that authenticated the subject.
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.

To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
`true` if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Causes this instance to be read-only.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
Reads the SAML authentication statement from the specified XML reader.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.ReadXml%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationInstant%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthenticationMethod%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.AuthorityBindings%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.DnsAddress%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement.IPAddress%2A>, and properties.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the SAML authentication statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML authentication statement that is defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader refers to an XML element that does not contain the `AuthenticationInstant` and `AuthenticationMethod` attributes.
reader refers to an XML element that does not have a `` child element.
Writes the SAML authentication statement into the specified XML serializer.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> to write the SAML authentication statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
